author: wrowe
msg: Optimize the win32 code with the (apr-internal) global apr_os_level,
and clean out an unneeded thunk (since all GetEffectiveRightsFromAcl
calls are by SID, we can always use the W version, peeling away the
A->W thunk in the WinNT kernel.)

author: wrowe
msg: Convert Win32 to apr_thread_mutex locking, rather than apr_lock.
This does _not_ work on win9x, but the CancelIo call right there
doesn't work either, so why hold up progress?  The right solution is
to emulate thread_mutex locking on 9x, so this patch is ultimately

author: wrowe
msg: An example of why we needed a pool-less apr_os_level.

author: wrowe
msg: Introduce apr_os_level, an apr-private internal value for optimizing
the resolution of os versions under Win32.  Since so many APIs rely on
this determination, this should improve the performance.  Pre-determine
the version within the apr_initialize() call.

author: trawick
msg: Fix a buglet that caused APR_FILE_BASED_SHM to be set inadvertently
